alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Canadian; Cleveland; Grady; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 11:22AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Grady, northern Seminole, east central Caddo, southern Oklahoma, southern Lincoln, Cleveland, southern Canadian, Pottawatomie and northwestern McClain Counties through 1145 AM CDT... At 1121 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Davenport to 5 miles northwest of Meeker to near Harrah to 3 miles northwest of Union City. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Shawnee, Del City, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Seminole, Tecumseh, Purcell, Mustang, Choctaw, Noble, Tuttle, Harrah, Slaughterville, McLoud, and Prague. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 95 and 126. Interstate 40 between mile markers 156 and 213. Interstate 44 between mile markers 81 and 119. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Caddo; Canadian; Cleveland; Grady; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie; Seminole
